Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 03:57PM ArleneMarie wrote: Donate your hair to Locks of Love if you have 10 inches or more or Pantene's Great Lengths if you have 9 inches.  It will make a difference in how you feel about your hair loss plus by cutting it off, you will feel more in control of your own destiny.
Posts.Title: In retrospect, what do you wish you knew before starting chemo? jamiebeth jamiebeth

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2010 09:05AM ArleneMarie wrote: HI Ladies, I am getting my first lymphatic massage tomorrow.  Is there anyone else doing that?  Just curious.  By the way, drains are now out and I feel so liberated with two expansions down and one more tomorrow after the massage (if I can handle it).
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 10:48AM ArleneMarie wrote: Hi DFWgal, Thank you so much for your reply. I am going to email your reply to my sister who may have some questions.  Her name is Caryl from Florida.  Thanks again.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 01:36PM ArleneMarie wrote: DFWGal, I emailed my sister your post and she is thinking about silicone versus the DIEP so I appreciate your input.  SHe is a bit upset because she just found out she is HER positive but she just needs a few days to wrap her head around it and then move out.  SHe is not a quitter :)  SHe will do what whe has to do like all of us, right?  By the way, I LOVE the icoupon idea of pity parties.  She is really creative :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 05:41PM ArleneMarie wrote: FloridaGirl, how long does he want you on Tamoxifien?  Just be careful of the side effects although my one firend who was DCIS five years ago did it for 5 years and had virtually no side effects.  Everyone is different. ericavw..I was laughing to myself because I had three people ask today how I was feeling one month  "in" with the expanders and I said 2 on pain and 6 on annoyance.  Same as your description :)  Also, I am so pleased that you were very aggressive with your move to handle the issue.  I also was born in NJ and I just knew I wanted to be proactive rather than just monitoring and waiting...and worrying.  I also am (or was an A) and I am headed for a full B.  WHoo Hoo!  My left nipple is healing so well but my right nipple is still slightly black.  I am also amazed that they both respond to touch and get stimulated.  I am absolutely amazed at how nicely this has gone thus far.  I sure hope the end result is good news for everyone!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2010 08:07AM ArleneMarie wrote: Yes panicking is very normal and I will be right there with you the night before my surgery.  Try to look beyond, if you can, and embrace the valium.  My prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2010 03:21PM ArleneMarie wrote: Firedancer, I had the same worries about the drainage once the drains were out and I was assured that the body absorbs it so no worries about that.  I am glad you pushed the issue and are on top of everything.  I hope you will feel much better by the end of this week :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 25, 2010 10:11AM ArleneMarie wrote: Laurie, I am so with you on feeling great and then "Bamn".  Although I did not get hit as hard as you but I went to the PS for a third expansion the othere day and then decided to go shopping at this cute dress store in the area with my beautiful surgical bra still on :)  Felt great!  Bought a few things.  Went to my in-laws for dinner and then the next day, I felt like I had a coat of armor around my breast area.  I should also add that I felt good enough to get off of all medications during that day..  Uh...wrong move!  I am now back in my fleece PJ's, taking 2 valiums and 4 Ibuprofens a day, drinking juices that my husband is making for me and watching stupid realitiy TV shows. Learned my lesson :)  Merry Christmas all :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 09:49PM ArleneMarie wrote: Hi All! Good luck Jacqueline and Paula!  I love reading about everyone's experience even though all of our bodies react differently.  I was supposed to have my third expansion last week but the PS said that we were moving a little too fast so I have it tomorrow.  I am doing well and I am interested in anyone that had the DIEP procedure since my sister now has to go through a bilateral mastectomy in January and she is scared of using the silicone implants which is what I am using.  How tough is the healing process with the DIEP? I can walk around and raise my arms and do most everything.  I know the recovery is longer but I am trying to gauge the difference esoececially since my sister has 2 kids while I do not have any to worry about.  Any input?
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2010 02:13PM ArleneMarie wrote:
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2010 08:32PM ArleneMarie wrote: Westie..I am so sorry to hear about your surgery but, if at all possible, please try and concentrate on letting your body heal right now.  It sound like you are a really strong woman and you will summon up the courage to move forward.  Remember...one step at a time.  My prayers are with you :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 05:49PM ArleneMarie wrote: Hi All, I was back home on Wednesday morning after bmx on Monday.  The drains pinch a bit but there is nothing I can do.  The PS couldn't put in the diret implants since he said it didn't look right so he ued the expanders instead.  The best way to descrie them is having a very tight Ace bandage around your breast area.  My nipples are turning black which isnot a good sign.  The PS told me not to worry too much be keep putting triple antibiotic on them.  I go to see him tomorrow.  My hospital was so quiet which was not what I expected.  I tried to be really tough an dnot use the morphine or valium and then I was scoled by the breast surgeon and PS. They told me tha the drugs alleviate the muscle spasms since the expandrs are under the muscle and the morphine makes you sleep.  I just hate drugs but I had to listen so I got off morphine by Tueaday and am only taking valium and antibiotics.  I can raise my hands which is good and I even got up today, made my coffee and emaile my ell-wishers.  I hope you are all having similar reactions and are doing well.  My thoughts are with you all :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2010 09:50AM ArleneMarie wrote: I had my PS "pump me up" with some more saline since I am in an accelerated move considering that in less than two weeks I am moving out of state.  Be prepared for that.  The pressure is more intense and I had a difficult time sleeping.  I am finally giving in and getting the Diluid (?) pain pill.  I was trying to do this all with the least amount of drugs.  Now, if I could just get that first bowel movement over and done with, I could truly be a happy camper.  I am trying prune juice today.  Any other suggestions???
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2010 08:32PM ArleneMarie wrote: Hi Ladies, Two full glasses of prune juice did the trick on the constipation as yucky as it ws to taste.  It worked though.  I go for my second saline injection tomorrow and I would like to take a walk out of this house since it is so confining but I will keep in mind what you said aobut the extra drainage.  You guys are so inspiring!  Thank you!!!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 08:25PM ArleneMarie wrote: To all the ladies getting ready to cut your hair, if you have 8 inches please donate it to Pantene Great Lengths if it is not bleached or dyed.  If it is 10 inches, please donate to Locks of Love.  I donated mine to Locks of Love since it was dyed but not bleached.  It will make you feel good!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 07:52AM ArleneMarie wrote: I am few days past my month post-op marker.  I wrote about it on my blog but in a nutshell.  I am not in too much pain but these expanders certainly are annoying.  If they could talk, they would be like a pesky friend that just keeps talking to let you know she's THERE.  I still have to wait a month for the last expansion and then the implant surgery is on March 16.  Goodness...I cannot wait.  I tried to exercise on the stationary bike becasue I gained 6 pounds (UGH) from not doing much and I did okay while on the bike but yesterday, I had a lot of pressure. from those stupid expanders.  I am off all mediactions except ibuprofen and I am trying desperately not to take valium.  How are you all doing?
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2010 08:17AM ArleneMarie wrote: Thanks Jane, Wow..it has been so encouragng to read what you all are feeling and going through.  So far, my anxiety level has been ultra low which is great.  I feel like I am a warrior preparing for a battle knowing full well that I have to participate so I just want to get through it and survive (feel better).  I had some worrisome news on Friday that my sister was dignosed with DCIS, high grade.  I immediately turned her onto this website and, hopefully, my experience with BPMX with reconstruction will alleviate some worry on her part since I think she will choose this option.  I have a question to those who went through the bi-lateral mastectomy already.  Is there anyone who signed up for a lymphatic masseuse?  I was told it makes a huge difference in healing so I lined up one here in Philly and then one in Savannah where we are moving come Jan 4.  I just wanted to know if anyone else is using their services?  Thanks guys :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2010 06:28PM ArleneMarie wrote: I am so glad to read about such upbeat results!  It is very encouraging.  I am sad to say that my only sister just joined me in discovering LCIS during a recent biopsy and I told her all about everyone on this website.  You guys are great support!  I will be thinking about you and am constantly following up on everyone :)
